data.title: Amphitheatre of El Jem
data.text: The Amphitheatre of El Jem is an oval amphitheatre in the modern day city of El Djem Tunisia formerly Thysdrus in the Roman province of Africa It is listed by UNESCO since 1979 as a World Heritage Site History The amphitheatre was built around 238 AD in Thysdrus located in the Roman province of Africa Proconsularis in present day El Djem Tunisia It is one of the best preserved Roman stone ruins in the world and is unique in Africa As other amphitheatres in the Roman Empire it was built for spectator events and it is one of the biggest amphitheatres in the world The estimated capacity is 35 000 and the sizes of the big and the small axes are respectively and The amphitheatre is built of stone blocks located on a flat ground and is exceptionally well conserved
